sen.e: OTOMO Ujiyasu (1321-1362) was a military commander in the latter half of the Kamakura Era till the Nanbokucho Era.

sen.j: 元弘3年/正慶2年(1333年)、父が鎮西探題・北条英時（赤橋英時）を攻める前、決死の覚悟で幕府に反逆しようとする父から家督を譲られた。
sen.e: His father bequeathed the family estate to him in 1333 before he went off to war with Chinzei Tandai and Hidetoki HOJO (Hidetoki AKAHASHI) in a last ditch rebellion against the government.

His father, who was to revolt against the bakufu government in the face of death, let him succeed to the family estate in 1333 before he attacked Hidetoki HOJO (Hidetoki AKAHASHI) of Chinzei tandai (office of the military governor of Kyushu).

sen.j: 五男である氏泰に家督を譲ったのは、当時成人していた四男までの息子より、幼少の氏泰に譲っておけば、仮に自身が敗死してもその後、幕府から咎められて取り潰される可能性は低いであろうと考えたためだと言われている。
sen.e: It was said that his father gave the family estate to Ujiyasu, who was his fifth son, instead of to Ujiyasu's older brothers, who had all reached adulthood, as he believed there was a lesser chance that the government would confiscate it from a minor, were he to die in defeat.

It is said that his father gave the family estate to Ujiyasu, who was his fifth son, instead of Ujiyasu's older brothers who had all reached adulthood, because the father thought the government would possibly not be apt to confiscate the family estate from the little child Ujisaki even if he was defeated to death in the battle.

sen.j: 同年12月、父が京都で急死したため、正式に当主となったが、幼少だったために兄・大友貞載の補佐を受けた。
sen.e: In December of the same year, his father suddenly died in Kyoto and he officially became the head of the family, but as he was still young, his older brother, OTOMO Sadatoshi assisted him in governing.

sen.j: その功績により室町幕府開設後、豊後国の他に肥前国・豊前国・日向国の守護に任じられた。
sen.e: Because of his accomplishments, after the Muromachi shogunate was established, he was appointed guardian over the Bungo Province, Hizen Province, Buzen Province and Hyuga Province.
